record.id: field.name=NULL and file.name=NULL and term="introformat" and format.name=NULL and syslanguage="en"

brief.brief: Forms Designer enables you to create a database table for a form, and enables you to design a form that does not have a database table associated with it.

detail.detail: Forms contain field prompts (label fields) and data entry areas (input fields).
You can specify input field characteristics with the options provided in the Edit Field Window.
Determine the field and key types using the Database Dictionary utility.

In order to create a form, you must give it a unique name. If you are associating the form with a database table, the form name should start with the table name. For example, vendor.view is a good name for a form that displays fields from the vendor table.
Note: File names cannot currently contain any characters except alphabetic and numeric characters, (no periods, spaces, dashes or other special characters.)
